channel.title: When Arranging Components On A User Interface...?
channel.description:
I'm finally starting to work with Swing and it's by far the best topic I've learnt so far :)
The book is telling me to, before arranging and putting components on the Interface, I should sketch it out on graph paper first, to get the sizes right and work out all the positioning.
Does anyone else do this before arranging components or do you just put them down and hope for the best?
Any other suggestions?

item.title: When Arranging Components On A User Interface...?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I’ve never done an extremely involved ui before, so I’ve never bothered…I just visualize it in my head and work towards it. If it doesn’t look right (which you normally can’t even tell on paper) I just rearrange it.

If you want to be strict though, it’s recommended to use uml, flowcharts, and pseudocode before writing up an application. I’m sure it might be useful when working on large applications, but honestly I’ve never done it before either…in the end, it’s really what you can be bothered to do that you actually get done.
